phrase.cizu_name: separate (或 sort) the wheat from the chaff

jx.jx_en_mean: distinguish valuable people or things from worthless ones

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cæf, ceaf, probably from a Germanic base meaning 'gnaw'; related to Dutch kaf, also to chafer

entry.def: Chaff is the outer part of grain such as wheat. It is removed before the grain is used as food.
If you separate the wheat from the chaff or sort the wheat from the chaff, you decide which people or things in a group are good or important and which are not.

example.ex: It isn't always easy to separate the wheat from the chaff.
example.tran: 分清良莠并不总是很容易。

means.word_mean: 1. material consisting of seed coverings and small pieces of stem or leaves that have been separated from the seeds
2. foil in thin strips; ejected into the air as a radar countermeasure
1. be silly or tease one another;
